title: Unable to build with cmake on Windows: missing: Python3_EXECUTABLE Interpreter

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
When attempting to build using cmake on Windows under MSVC, the `cmake` command attempts to find `python3`. This fails for some reason, and does not give any more information.

This occurs regardless of whether I run `python x.py build` or `python3 x.py build`, as long as I set `ninja=false` in `config.toml`. No other changes are made.
